body_html:
Wait, for custom user_op, if you build it as a dll, then you can put it into a separated project, which is not part of the tensorflow.sln. So you don't have to use either cmake or bazel. All the issues described here are gone.

If you put your custom user_op inside tensorflow source tree, it's another story. Yes. you can build it with bazel, and it's very fast.
body_text:
Wait, for custom user_op, if you build it as a dll, then you can put it into a separated project, which is not part of the tensorflow.sln. So you don't have to use either cmake or bazel. All the issues described here are gone.
If you put your custom user_op inside tensorflow source tree, it's another story. Yes. you can build it with bazel, and it's very fast.
body:
Wait, for custom user_op, if you build it as a dll, then you can put it into a separated project, which is not part of the tensorflow.sln. So you don't have to use either cmake or bazel. All the issues described here are gone.  

If you put your custom user_op inside tensorflow source tree, it's another story. Yes. you can build it with bazel, and it's very fast.
